meanings.definition: A group or cluster of people or things.
meanings.sent1: During recess, a clatch of students gathered around the monkey bars.
meanings.sent2: The toys were scattered around the room, forming a colorful clatch on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The clatch of colorful balloons made the birthday party even more festive.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky formed a beautiful clatch, twinkling above.
meanings.sent5: The clatch of birds flying in formation was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: To grasp or hold onto something tightly.
meanings.sent1: She had to clatch onto the railing to steady herself on the rocking boat.
meanings.sent2: The child clatched onto his favorite stuffed animal for comfort.
meanings.sent3: The kitten clatched onto the yarn, thinking it was a fun toy.
meanings.sent4: He clatched onto the idea of going on a road trip for the weekend.
meanings.sent5: The hiker clatched onto the rope as he descended down the steep cliff.

meanings.sent1: The neighbors would often clatch over the fence about the latest news.
meanings.sent2: At the coffee shop, friends would clatch about their weekend plans.
meanings.sent3: The ladies would clatch about the new family in town, curious to know more.
meanings.sent4: During lunch break, coworkers would clatch about the upcoming office party.
meanings.sent5: Teenagers would clatch in the school hallway, sharing stories and laughter.
